Sequence Information.Source: circularization, amino acid SUBSTITUTION, defensin analog, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (93.94%) toRabbit neutrophil peptide 1 NP-1R: 30%; C: 18%; G=L: 12%.Activity: low salt, active against E. coli (MIC 1.6 ug/ml), S. typhimurium (MIC 4.3 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa (MIC 4.8 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae (MIC 5.3 ug/ml), L. monocytogenes (MIC 1.7 ug/ml), and C. albicans (MIC 19.0 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness: NaCl-insensitive:E. coli (100 mM), NaCl-sensitive:S. typhimurium (100 mM), NaCl-insensitive:P. aeruginosa (100 mM), NaCl-sensitive:K. pneumoniae (100 mM), NaCl-insensitive:L. monocytogenes (100 mM), NaCl-sensitive:C. albicans (100 mM).In vitro toxicity: human RBC, not hemo.lytic (HC50 1830 ug/ml).
Literature Information.Author: Yu Q, Lehrer RI, Tam JP.2000
Literature Information.Title: Engineered salt-insensitive alpha-defensins with end-to-end circularized structures
